description: From French quartette, from Italian quartetto. Doublet of cuarteto and quartetto.

definitionGroups.group: A group of four people or things, particularly

entries.meaning: (music) A group of four musicians who perform classical music together.
examples: The string quartet played some chamber music.

entries.meaning: (music) A musical composition in four parts, each performed by a single voice or instrument.
(music) A group of four singers, usually males, who sings together in four-part harmony.
examples: The barbershop quartet performed the composition a capella.
